page_title: Sealgw - Cloud-Native High-Performance 4/7 Layer Gateway (In Dev)

hero.title: Cloud-Native High-Performance 4/7 Layer Hybrid Gateway
hero.subtitle: Sealgw (In Development) is built for the Sealos platform, unifying your traffic with extreme security and kernel-level speed.

features.title: Core Features: Performance and Security
features.f1_desc: Utilizes high-performance LVS for Layer 4 proxying, complemented by robust Layer 7 routing, authentication, and API governance.
features.f2_desc: Native support for WAF, DDoS mitigation, and mandatory TLS/SSL termination, building the first line of defense at the gateway.
features.f3_desc: Provides dynamic rate limiting, circuit breaking, and request rewriting for fine-grained control over all services on Sealos.
features.f4_desc: Deep integration of the `lvscare` mechanism ensures continuous high availability for the gateway entry point and backend Real Server lists.

advantages.title: Sealgw Design Philosophy
advantages.a1_desc: From the underlying LVS selection to the upper-layer proxy implementation, all design aims for minimal latency and maximum throughput.
advantages.a2_desc: Configuration is fully declarative, managed via Kubernetes API for seamless GitOps integration.
advantages.a3_desc: Deeply integrated with Sealos platform modules like storage, monitoring, and authentication, reducing operational complexity.

status.title: Project Status and Roadmap
status.phase: Current Phase: Core functionality development, focusing on the stability and performance testing of the LVS + L7 core proxy logic.
status.short_term: Short-Term Goal: Complete basic 4/7 layer routing, TLS termination, and fundamental lvscare high-availability integration.
status.contribute: Get Involved: We welcome all community developers to contribute code, provide feedback, and participate in architecture design. Join our GitHub community!
